TopicTitle: Constant Crashing in 0.25 possible memory issue

Articles.Content:
Hi,

I've been getting a lot of crashes in KSP 0.25 32 bit which ended up being due to memory constraints. I installed Active Texture Management and reduced the texture size of Real Solar System and I was crash free until today. I left the house for several hours with KSP running and when I returned I attempted to launch a rocket and it crashed. Opened the game up again and another crash. I tried restarting my computer, monitoring the RAM usage, and checking the logs myself but I didn't see any clear indication of the game using too much RAM (sitting around 3.3gb during flight)

I did not change anything between when it was working and these constant crashes.

Here is my output.txt:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/4rk1czkr74f5bnx/output_log.txt?dl=0

List of mods/files in GameData (all up to date for .25, just downloaded all of them 2 days prior to .90 release)

000_Toolbar

000_USITools

ActiveTextureManagement

AdvancedAnimator

AIES_Aerospace

ASET

BahaSP

BoulderCo

CIT

ConnectedLivingSpace

CustomAsteroids

CustomBiomes

DarkMultiplayer

DeadlyReentry

FusTek

HexCans

HullCameraVDS

JSI

KAS

KerbalEngineer

NBody

NEBULA

RealFuels

RealismOverhaul

RealSolarSystem

RemoteTech

SelectRoot

ShipManifest

Squad

TextureReplacer

ThunderAerospace

Trajectories

TweakScale

UniversalStorage

XanderTek

ModuleManager.2.5.3.dll

ModuleManager.ConfigCache

ModuleManager.ConfigSHA

toolbar-settings

Specs:

i5 3570k @4ghz

Nvidia gtx 780 (gpu drivers up to date)

8gb ram

Windows 7

I've also tried adding -force-dxd11, that fixed all the crashing but created graphical glitches like pink texures and shadows flashing. Adding -force-opengl removes all my mods (probably something I'm doing wrong here)

Also, I did not try this in a clean game install as that would fix the crash problem most likely as I'm almost certain this is still due to RAM issues. I believe that covers all the info requested of me per the sticky, if there is anything else needed for me to do/info to provide I'd be happy to do so.

Regards,

James
That's a lot of mods, I doubt you'll be able to ever run all that on 32- bit.

That's a lot of mods, I doubt you'll be able to ever run all that on 32- bit.

Yeah I was getting 12-15 crashes a day before I installed ActiveTextureManagement. After that I could play with maybe 1 crash a day. I'm trying to figure out what changed that in a couple hours. Perhaps installing the aggressive version of ActiveTextureManagement?
